headline: Piper Sandler remains bullish on Tesla in auto stock downgrades
summary: Piper Sandler has downgraded US auto stocks, cutting the price targets on Rivian (RIVN) and Stellantis (STLA) while maintaining an Overweight rating on EV leader Tesla (TSLA). Madison Mills and StoneX senior adviser Jon Hilsenrath assess how Wall Street is forecasting President Trump's tariffs to weigh on automakers and create further uncertainty for the broader auto industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: GM, Nvidia to partner on AI tech for factories and next-gen vehicles
summary: The automaker will build vehicles on Nvidia’s Drive AGX platform to speed up development and the deployment of autonomous driving technology at scale.
